title.narrative: Programme Document on Climate Change, Conflict, Displacement and Irregular Migration in Sahel

description.narrative:
Objective The objective of the assignment is to finalise the program document for the new four-year programme.
Background and context The Danish finance act for 2021 includes a multiannual initiative on climate change, conflict, forced displacement and irregular migration in Africa with a specific focus on Sahel, allocating DKK 200 million each year for the next four years. The financing act underscores the importance of integrating a strong prevention focus that is climate-sensitive when addressing compound risks that drive fragility, conflict, displacement and irregular migration in the region. This program aims to focus and complement ongoing and planned regional and cross-border responses, by Denmark and partners through targeted support that integrates a longer-term preventive, climate-sensitive approach to underlying risks that drive fragility, conflict and irregular migration and forced displacement. The first two engagements to be supported by the new Programme have been identified and proposed. These are support to adaptive social protection in Sahel with the World Bank, including France, UK and Germany and, secondly, support to a new partnership with IFAD (ASAP+) that supports small farmers in Sahel cope with the effects of climate change. The volatility of the operational environment warrants a flexible and adaptive approach for commitments in the following years. Funds are reserved for additional activities in the coming years with UNDP, the Netherlands, and a new partnership with the European Commission as well as unallocated funds. A draft programme document has been prepared for the future support. However, before the programme is ready for submission for the approving authorities, recommendations from the appraisal must be included in the draft programme document must include, as appropriate.
